channel.title: Pohang on Every Corner of Korea

item.title: Comfort and hope to all with the new light! The 21st Pohang Homigot Korean National Sunrise Festival - Pohang, Gyeongbuk, Korea
item.description:
Majestic Homigot Sunrise

Comfort and hope to all with the new light! The 21st Pohang Homigot Korean National Sunrise Festival

Pohang, Gyeongbuk, Korea

On the first day of the new year, the 'Homi Cape Korean People's Celebration' is held at Pomi Homigot Square.
Homigot Sunrise, a new hope for all
Homi Cape, located in Nam-gu, Pohang, is the tail of the Korean peninsula, the Korean peninsula. Speaking of tails often comes to mind negative meanings such as end and back. Like the crowned crown, it can be used to mean incompleteness such as failure or abandonment.
Homigot's morning dawn
But tails are very important to animals. Especially for predators of carnivores, the tail is directly linked to survival. When hunting, the tail turns and balances. The tiger runs with the power of the tail, and conducts the flock with the tail. This is why the tiger tail is regarded as a symbol of national fortune and national security. Homigot New Year's first sunrise, which will be comforting and hopeful for everyone, is more meaningful.
Sculpture representing the Korean Peninsula in the form of a tiger
The sunrise spot of Pohang is by far the Homigot Sunrise Square. The New Millennium Memorial Hall, the Korea Tourism Luxury Museum, and the Yeon Orang Seon Statue were built around the square.
Win-Win Hand Golden Sun Rising Through Fingers
The win-win hand, the symbol of the Homigot Sunrise Square, is the two hands on the sea and land facing the palms.
Foreign tourists enjoy watching sunrise at Cape Homi
In front of the left hand on the ground is a torch and a thousand-year-old pupil. The embers in the eyes of the millennium are kept in the 'Eternal Embers', which combines the last 20th century embers cultivated on the Byeonsan Peninsula, the embers of the earth cultivated in Fiji South Pacific, the Zhuhai Sea embers cultivated in Dokdo, and the beginnings of the new millenniums cultivated at Homigot. It is.
Win-win hands and eyes of a thousand years
On December 31, at the sunrise, Haeoreum Busking Festival, Changhyeon Street Karaoke <Homi Hen>, Madang Play <Homi Cape Hyo Woman Shim Cheong Jeon>, 퐝! 퐝! Various programs are held, including the fireworks festival and Daewol Hanmadang. Additional events such as Homie Freemarket and Homie Visible Radio are also held.
Yeon-ang Rang O
The Sunrise Hope Radio, 70th Anniversary! There will be a painting of North Korea and a performance of <The Year of Visit to Pohang>. In addition, `` Feast of rice cake soup is a pig '' event, which is made with rice cake soup in the largest pot in Korea and shares the first meal of the new year, is also held. The 2019 Homigot New Year sunrise is 7:33.
Yeongildae Beach, a night view spot in Pohang
Many things to see and do around Cape Homi
If you have been deeply impressed by the sunrise of Homigot Sunrise Square, it is time to look around. The first place to visit is the National Lighthouse Museum. Located at Homigot Sunrise Square, the National Lighthouse Museum is Korea's only lighthouse museum. The National Lighthouse Museum provides a variety of information about the lighthouse, including the history of the lighthouse, including Korea, as well as the types and principles of the lighthouse.
Homigot Lighthouse, the tallest in Korea
There are many interesting exhibits, such as a diorama, which reproduces the life of the lighthouse keeper called the lighthouse keeper, and the experience of making Morse code using a touch screen. It is also interesting to look at the history and history of Korea's lighthouse. Korea's first lighthouse is Palmido Lighthouse in Palmido, Incheon. The Homigot Lighthouse, which can be found at the National Lighthouse Museum, is the tallest lighthouse in Korea.
National Lighthouse Museum is Korea's only lighthouse museum
Don't miss the Millennium Memorial Hall, which embodies the round sun. The Millennium Memorial Hall is an exhibition center where visitors can meet Pohang's geographic characteristics, history, and future vision with various panels and dioramas, and about 2,000 rare marine life fossils, including the world's first photosynthetic organism, stromatolite and fossil fossils. There is a museum and the Korea Seokpo Pohang Museum where 300 rare heads are gathered together.
Homigot Sunrise Square from the roof of the Millennium Memorial Hall
Climb up to the rooftop observatory on the 3rd floor and you'll see Homigot Square and the blue East Sea.
Ammonite fossils displayed at the Marine Natural History Museum
Pohang's best gourmet in winter
Guryongpo, about 10 km from Cape Homi, is home to Guamegi. When talking about Pohang's winter, Guamegi does not fall with the sunrise. Guamegi originated from shrubs that were herringed through her eyes and is now in season. It's a bit weird to eat lettuce and seaweed, and it's a bit grotesque to eat with chopped guamegi and chopped green onions. The texture is chewy and chewy. If you are a liquor lover, you can have a cup of Pohang's representative makgeolli, “Young-ilman Friends,” made with Pohang rice and rice cakes. Darakbang, Guamegi Restaurant, located in Yanghakcheon-ro, Buk-gu, Pohang-si, is famous for aging over 10 months.
Guamegi is full of luster now.
If you enjoyed the taste of savory guamegi, it's time to learn about it. As Gumaegi's hometown, there is Guamegi Cultural Center in Guryongpo. The official name is 'Pohang Guryongpo Guamegi Cultural Center'. Guamegi Cultural Center is located in the back of Kowloon Park, where Kowloon Pohang is located, and was opened in May 2016. The four-story cultural hall includes the Guamegi Research Center, a public relations hall, an ocean experience center, and an ocean hall.
Pohang Guryongpo Guamegi Cultural Center
The origin and efficacy of Guamegi are also reproduced, as well as the famous Guryongpo fishing village houses and the famous saury fishing boat built in 1945. Touch pool where you can touch fish such as willowfish and albino trout, and VR video experience space that virtually experiences the Arctic is popular with children.
Exhibition of drying Guamegi
Travel info

21st Homigot Korean National Celebration

-Address: Homigot Sunrise Square, Homigot-myeon, Nam-gu, Pohang-si, Gyeongbuk

-Date: December 31, 2018 (18:00) ~ January 1, 2019 (Sunrise 07: 33 ~)

Inquiries: 054-289-7851 (Pohang Foundation for Festival Management)

http://phcf.or.kr/kr/main.do


National Lighthouse Museum

-Address: 20 Haetim-ro 150beon-gil, Homigot-myeon, Nam-gu, Pohang-si, Gyeongbuk

Contact: 054-284-4857

-Opening hours: 09: 00 ~ 18: 00 (Closed every Monday, but open on January 1st)

Admission Fee: Free

http://www.lighthouse-museum.or.kr/kr/


Millennium Memorial Hall

-Address: 136 Haetgi-ro, Homigot-myeon, Nam-gu, Pohang-si, Gyeongbuk

Contact: 054-284-5026

-Opening hours: 09: 00 ~ 18: 00 (Closed every Monday)

Admission Fee: Adults 3,000 won, Teenagers 1000 won, Children 500 won


Pohang Guryongpo Guamegi Cultural Center

-Address: 28-8, Guryongpo-gil 117beon-gil, Guryongpo-eup, Nam-gu, Pohang-si, Gyeongbuk

Contact: 054-270-2861

-Opening hours: 09: 00 ~ 18: 00 (Closed on Mondays, January 1st, and Chuseok)

-Admission Fee: Free

http://gmg.pohang.go.kr/


Restaurants near

-Darakbang Guamegi: Guamegi / 39, Yanghakcheon-ro, Jukdo-dong, Buk-gu, Pohang-si, Gyeongbuk / 054-283-1915

-Haikou Restaurant: Guamegi / 18, Jungangsangga 2-gil, Buk-gu, Pohang-si, Gyeongbuk / 054-247-5801

-Gayoung Lodge: Tongue Pork Barbecue / 223 Jamyeong-ro, Yeonil-eup, Nam-gu, Pohang-si, Gyeongbuk / 054-278-9477


Rooms

-Apple Tree Hotel: 7-5, Jungheung-ro 100beon-gil, Nam-gu, Pohang-si, Gyeongbuk / 054-241-1234

http://appletreehotels.com/pohang

-Eco Hotel: 430, Posco-daero, Nam-gu, Pohang, Gyeongbuk / 054-282-8787

http://www.ecobusinesshotel.co.kr
